message_1:
Find the equation of the mirror quintic Calabi-Yau threefold in Fano variety of the following projective space:

$$\mathbb{P}^4=\{(z_0:z_1:z_2:z_3:z_4)\mid z_i\in\mathbb{C}\}.$$
message_2:
The mirror quintic Calabi-Yau threefold in the Fano variety of the projective space $\mathbb{P}^4$ is given by the following equation:

$$\sum_{i=0}^{4} z_i^5 = 5\psi \prod_{i=0}^{4} z_i,$$

where $\psi$ is a complex parameter. This equation represents a family of Calabi-Yau threefolds, and the parameter $\psi$ determines the specific member of the family.
